title: Principal Full Stack Software Engineer (Infrastructure)
description:
Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks®, we’re united by a shared mission—to protect our digital way of life. We thrive at the intersection of innovation and impact, solving real-world problems with cutting-edge technology and bold thinking. Here, everyone has a voice, and every idea counts. If you’re ready to do the most meaningful work of your career alongside people who are just as passionate as you are, you’re in the right place.

Who We Are

In order to be the cybersecurity partner of choice, we must trailblaze the path and shape the future of our industry. This is something our employees work at each day and is defined by our values: Disruption, Collaboration, Execution, Integrity, and Inclusion. We weave AI into the fabric of everything we do and use it to augment the impact every individual can have. If you are passionate about solving real-world problems and ideating beside the best and the brightest, we invite you to join us!

We believe collaboration thrives in person. That’s why most of our teams work from the office full time, with flexibility when it’s needed. This model supports real-time problem-solving, stronger relationships, and the kind of precision that drives great outcomes.

Job Summary

Your Career

We are seeking a highly experienced Principal Full Stack Engineer to lead the design and development of scalable, high-impact software systems. This role requires deep technical expertise across frontend and backend technologies, strong leadership in driving projects from concept to production (0 → 1), and a passion for building platforms that empower engineering teams, particularly Internal Developer Portals (IDPs). As a Principal Engineer, you will set technical direction, mentor engineers, collaborate closely with product and leadership teams, and deliver robust solutions that scale with the business.

Your Impact
• Lead end-to-end architecture, design, and development of full stack applications
• Drive greenfield (0 → 1) initiatives from ideation to production
• Architect scalable backend services and APIs using Node.js, Express, and Python/Go
• Build high-quality frontend applications using React and Material UI (experience with Backstage is a plus)
• Define engineering best practices, coding standards, and architectural patterns
• Mentor and guide engineers across teams through technical leadership and code reviews
• Collaborate with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to translate business needs into technical solutions
• Ensure system performance, reliability, security, and maintainability
• Lead incident response, debugging, and system optimization efforts

Qualifications

Your Experience
• BS or MS in Computer Science or related field
• 8+ years of experience in full stack or software engineering roles with principal-level impact
• Strong background in system design and software architecture
• Demonstrated ability to ship high-quality products end-to-end
• Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

Technical Skills

Frontend
• Strong expertise in React
• Experience with Material UI or similar component libraries
• Proficiency in modern JavaScript/TypeScript
• Deep understanding of frontend architecture, state management, and performance optimization

Backend
• Extensive experience with Node.js and Express
• Strong programming experience in Python and/or Go
• Experience designing RESTful APIs and microservices
• Strong knowledge of authentication, authorization, and security best practices

Platform & Infrastructure
• Experience building or working with Internal Developer Portals (IDPs) (major plus)
• Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
• Experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes preferred)
• CI/CD pipelines and DevOps best practices

Data & Systems
• Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
• Strong system design skills for scalability, reliability, and performance
• Experience with observability tools (logging, monitoring, tracing)

Leadership & Experience
• Proven experience leading complex engineering projects, including 0 → 1 initiatives
• Ability to own technical vision and influence engineering strategy across teams
• Strong mentorship, coaching, and cross-functional collaboration skills
• Experience driving architectural decisions at scale
• Comfortable operating in fast-paced, ambiguous environments

Nice to Have
• Experience designing platform tooling or developer experience (DX) solutions
• Knowledge of event-driven architectures
• Open-source contributions or technical thought leadership

What You’ll Bring
• A builder mindset with strong ownership and accountability
• Deep technical expertise combined with strategic thinking
• Passion for improving developer productivity and platform engineering
• Ability to balance hands-on development with technical leadership

#LI-TD1

Compensation Disclosure

The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/com-missioned roles) is expected to be the annual range listed below. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.

$147,000.00 - $237,500.00/yr

Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship?: Yes

title: Software Engineer III
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...It’s an exciting time to join the Walmart journey. Want to use design and coding skills to solve real-life large-scale problems impacting millions of lives? EBS provides people and business shared services globally for all of Walmart’s lines of businesses including People, Finance, Digital Experience and Global Governance. About Team: Our Imports tech team within EBS Finance department is responsible for carrying out various financial operations connected with import goods shipment. These tasks include managing payments for both supplier and non-supplier companies involved in these shipments, creating financial entries (GL) and posting them to SAP, managing the import PO lifecycle from a financial perspective, and conducting end-to-end reconciliation of processed payments. What you'll do:
• Playing part of an engineering team in software design and implementation, upholding our architectural patterns, design patterns, coding standards, quality principles, and customer focus.
• Putting our data to work by building a world class data foundation that supports applications, analytics and AI capabilities that solve real world financial problems.
• Explore Walmart’s enterprise data ecosystems to identify opportunities.
• Perform research, EDA, and root cause analysis on data discrepancies to improve data models.
• Transform data from warehouses and lakes into models using SQL, Python, and dbt to surface missed recoveries.
• Building event driven and microservice powered applications to interact with SQL and No-SQL Databases to achieve Walmart’s Finance modernization efforts.
• Working across multiple lines of business to modernize processes, helping teams deliver features at a rapid pace to ensure we build scalable and sustainable value-stream products for our business and associates.
• Partnering with Infrastructure and Platform teams to identify gaps and opportunities to invest time and resources to improve delivery across the organization
• Improving the software technology environment through application of industry best practices; researching the latest developments in software technology applicable to the enterprise; analyzing industry best practices; and benchmarking internal processes and solutions against industry technology and trends
• Assisting in the development, training, and mentoring of associates by providing guidance, and building a team-based work environment; leveraging data to establish performance goals and working with management to improve the working environment;
• Promoting and supporting company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by training and providing direction to others in their use and application.
• Ensure business needs are being met by evaluating the ongoing effectiveness of current plans, programs, and initiatives; consulting with business partners, managers, co-workers, or other key stakeholders; soliciting, evaluating, and applying suggestions for improving efficiency and cost effectiveness; and participating in and supporting community outreach events.
What you'll bring:
• Experience in building and modernizing a broad array of technology spanning both front and backend development.
• Experience with SQL and no-SQL Databases such as Redis, SQLite, Milvus, DB2, MS SQL, Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Google BigQuery.
• Strong expertise in data modeling, SQL, Python, and dbt; experience with EDA, audit-focused data transformations, and maintaining ELT systems with CI/CD pipelines.
• Familiarity with AI/ML techniques and information extraction (OCR, email analytics, Document AI) is a plus.
• Experience with AI, Generative AI, Data Science or probabilistic mathematics.
• Demonstrated experience with design and testing patterns.
• Demonstrated ability to lead and participate in medium- to large-scale projects by writing and reviewing code, reviewing project requirements, translating requirements into technical solutions by partnering with the product management, project management, business, and user experience teams. Prepare requested information and obtain cross-function approvals.
• Strong experience with cloud native technology and platform capabilities.
• Clear, concise communication skills with strong leadership and influential abilities.
• Ability to multitask between several different requirements and features concurrently.
• Superior analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude.
• Ability to perform in a team environment.
• Have a true passion about Technology.
• Applied exposure to Agile Methodologies.
• Strong development experience in multiple modern programming languages and frameworks such as NodeJs, Python, ReactJS, Java, Flask, Electrode, NextJS.
About Walmart Global Tech Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail. Flexible, hybrid work: We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives. Benefits: Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more. Equal Opportunity Employer: Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process. At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices. Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.
For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
The annual salary range for this position is $90,000.00 - $180,000.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include :
- Stock

ㅤ

ㅤ

ㅤ

ㅤ

‎
Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 2 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.
Option 2: 4 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering, or related area, We value candidates with a background in creating inclusive digital experiences, demonstrating knowledge in implementing Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 AA standards, assistive technologies, and integrating digital accessibility seamlessly. The ideal candidate would have knowledge of accessibility best practices and join us as we continue to create accessible products and services following Walmart’s accessibility standards and guidelines for supporting an inclusive culture.

Masters: Computer Science

Primary Location...

2914 Se I St, Bentonville, AR 72712-3148, United States of America

Walmart and its subsidiaries are committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace and has a no tolerance policy regarding the use of illegal drugs and alcohol on the job. This policy applies to all employees and aims to create a safe and productive work environment.

title: Power Delivery Engineer – New Graduate
description:
Join ENERCON as a new graduate Power Delivery Engineer contributing to design, analysis, and inspection of critical energy infrastructure.

Your Role

Key responsibilities include:
• Contribute to design, analysis, and inspection of transmission lines, substations, and greenfield distribution projects
• Work within multidisciplinary teams supporting utilities, independent power producers, and industrial clients
• Apply industry tools, current codes, and standards in project work
• Collaborate with senior engineers for field data collection and project execution
• Engage in field work and site walkdowns, including climbing stairs and ladders
• Manage multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to new software systems
• Maintain a positive attitude towards learning, feedback, and professional growth

About You

The company is looking for candidates who meet the following qualifications:
• Graduated or graduating with a bachelor’s or master’s degree from an ABET-accredited school in Electrical, Mechanical, Civil Engineering, or related disciplines
• Available to start between May 2026 and August 2026, with preference for May-June 2026 graduates
• Strong intellectual curiosity about modern energy systems
• Preferred coursework: Power Systems Engineering, Power Electronics, Power Systems Analysis & Control, Electric Power Quality
• Proficient in Microsoft Suite
• Excellent writing, presentation, and communication skills
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in teams
• Effective problem-solving skills
• Physical ability to climb stairs and ladders and navigate client sites
• Willingness and ability to work outdoors and travel for projects and meetings
• Completion of pre-interview assessments and submission of college transcript if under one year post-graduation
• Ability to pass pre-employment and random drug and alcohol screenings, background checks, and annual motor vehicle record checks
• Must be legally eligible to work in the US without sponsorship

Compensation & Benefits
• Salary range: $71,000 to $85,000, based on role, level, experience, and location
• Full benefits for employee and dependents starting day one, with no waiting period
• Flexible work arrangements including hybrid and alternative schedules
• 401(k) with employer matching
• Tuition reimbursement
• Professional Engineer (PE) license support and incentives

Training & Development
• Mentorship from experienced engineers
• Exposure to field work and multidisciplinary collaboration
• Opportunities to build technical and project management skills
• Support for professional growth and development

Career Progression
• Opportunities for growth and advancement within a dynamic and innovative company

How to Apply
• Complete pre-interview assessments
• Submit college transcript if under one year of experience post-graduation
• Pass required drug, alcohol, background, and motor vehicle record checks

This job may close before the stated closing date, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible

Report this job
